# Sustainable Supply Chain
#### Sustainable Procurement Policy
To support suppliers in adopting ESG practices and strengthening their sustainability resilience, Arcadyan has established the "Supplier Sustainability Investigation Standard", covering four key mechanisms: new supplier evaluation, ongoing supplier management, auditing, and coaching. "[Arcadyan Sustainable Procurement Policy](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/resources/documents/Arcadyan_Sustainable_Procurement_Policy.pdf)" serves as a key framework for implementing sustainable supply chain governance. In 2024, Arcadyan officially incorporated information security clauses into the updated "[Arcadyan Supplier CSR commitment](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/resources/documents/Arcadyan_Supplier_CSR_commitment.pdf)" covering seven key areas: organizational governance, labor rights, occupational health and safety, environmental protection, management systems, ethics standards, and grievance mechanisms. 325 suppliers have signed back on this commitment, achieving a 100% compliance rate. Arcadyan continues to require all suppliers to fully comply with domestic and international environmental and social laws and regulations, while strengthening the protection of confidential information to prevent potential data leakage in business transactions. These actions demonstrate Arcadyan's strong commitment to sustainable supply chain management and information security governance.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926160706-1.png)
###### 2024 Sustainable Supply Chain Achievements Summary
  * **Supplier Conference:**  
Facilitated knowledge sharing and discussions on emerging environmental and social issues facing the industry. Introduced the Green Product Management System platform and related compliance requirements, strengthening communication and engagement with suppliers.
  * **Sustainable Procurement Training:**  
Conducted training sessions covering the ISO 20400 Sustainable Procurement Guidelines and common issues identified in RBA audits. A total of twenty-one procurement staff participated, accumulating forty-two training hours, achieving a 100% training completion rate.
  * **Supplier CSR Commitment Signing:**  
Achieved a 100% return rate for the Supplier Corporate Social Responsibility Commitment Letter, which covers seven key management principles, promoting supplier compliance with environmental and social responsibility standards.
  * **New Supplier Evaluation:**  
Completed assessments for twenty-one new suppliers, covering aspects such as labor rights, health and safety, environmental protection, corporate governance, business ethics, and grievance mechanisms.
  * **Supplier Risk Assessment:**  
Conducted comprehensive evaluations based on product category, transaction status, and ESG performance. In 2024, no high-risk suppliers were identified; nineteen medium-risk suppliers were selected for on-site audits.
  * **Supplier Audit:**  
In accordance with RBA standards, Arcadyan completed on-site audits for sixteen medium-risk suppliers and remote document reviews for three suppliers. Additionally, distributed integrity questionnaires to forty-one suppliers, achieving a 100% response rate with no findings of business ethics violations or inappropriate hospitality.


###### Supplier Sustainability Risk Assessment
Arcadyan developed a supplier sustainability risk assessment mechanism to enhance supply chain management efficiency and resilience through the identification of potential risks. The assessment covers nine key dimensions: location, product category, transaction size, sales model, conflict mineral management, hazardous substances control, business continuity risk, labor rights, and CSR performance. A comprehensive evaluation is conducted through questionnaires and data analysis. In 2024, the assessment results indicated no high-risk suppliers. For forty-one medium-risk suppliers, Arcadyan completed 100% of integrity due diligence investigations, ensuring integrity and responsible governance across the supply chain.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926161228-2.png)
###### Supplier CSR Audits
In alignment with the Responsible Business Alliance (RBA) Code of Conduct, Arcadyan developed a Supplier CSR Audit Checklist to conduct on-site reviews for suppliers identified as having potential high-risk factors. The audit covers eleven key dimensions, with "Environmental Management" and" Health and Safety" accounting for 55% of the total score, and the remaining nine dimensions comprising the other 45%. In 2024, Arcadyan selected nineteen key suppliers from the medium-risk list for on-site audits, completing sixteen onsite inspections and three document reviews, achieving a 100% completion rate. Additionally, in response to clients' requirements, Arcadyan conducted an on-site audit and improvement guidance for one Tier-2 supplier, further expanding the depth of sustainable supply chain management and enhancing accountability.
Since 2016, Arcadyan has actively participated in the Joint Alliance for CSR (JAC), working with global telecommunications operators to advance Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) practices within the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) industry supply chain. In 2024, Arcadyan arranged six suppliers to participate in JAC audits. For suppliers that did not meet the required standards, Arcadyan provided immediate assistance in setting improvement targets and timelines, along with support resources, to continuously strengthen the effectiveness of sustainable supply chain management.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926161430-3.png)
###### Supplier Coaching
Arcadyan continues to strengthen the sustainability capabilities of its suppliers by regularly following up and providing improvement guidance on non-conformities identified during Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) audits. In 2024, Arcadyan guided nineteen suppliers to complete corrective actions for CSR-related deficiencies, with the three primary areas of improvement—Health and Safety, Environmental Management, and Working Hours & Overtime—accounting for approximately 70% of all findings. In the area of environmental management, Arcadyan established a professional green information platform to provide the latest updates on international environmental regulations and procedural requirements. This platform enables suppliers to stay informed about regulatory changes, monitor compliance status, and access real-time records of document submissions and updates, thereby enhancing overall supply chain compliance capability.
Arcadyan also actively participates in client-initiated Sustainable Development Programs (SDP), assisting suppliers in adopting the management standards of the Responsible Business Alliance (RBA) and the Joint Alliance for CSR (JAC). The program focuses on ten aspects of ESG, including strategy, management system, stakeholder engagement, resource management, environmental management, life cycle thinking, worker treatment, labor practices, human rights, and supplier development. This is a two-year project aimed at improving sustainability performance, during which Arcadyan supports suppliers in developing sustainability management programs. In 2024, two suppliers participated in this initiative and achieved Silver-level sustainability performance certification.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926161632-4.png)
###### Recognition of Outstanding Suppliers
Arcadyan revised its Outstanding Supplier Selection Mechanism, with evaluation criteria covering suppliers' incoming material quality performance, number of customer complaints, effectiveness of corrective actions, and service coordination capability for the year. In addition, Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) performance has been added as a scoring category to strengthen the overall sustainability performance of the supply chain. In procurement decisions, Arcadyan gives priority consideration to suppliers recognized as outstanding, to acknowledge their overall performance. For suppliers whose performance does not meet the standard, procurement allocation may be adjusted based on their improvement progress, and such performance serves as a reference in the supplier phase-out mechanism.
To commend partners that have excelled in environmental and social performance, Arcadyan awarded 15 outstanding suppliers, encouraging the supply chain to collectively enhance CSR performance. Arcadyan continues to focus on innovative products and technologies, integrating upstream and downstream resources to provide clients with comprehensive sustainable solutions, while actively taking responsibility for Arcadyan's economic, social, and environmental impacts to foster a positive cycle of industrial and environmental sustainability.
  

#### Go Green with Arcadyan Carbon Reduction Project
###### Program Background
In response to growing international policy trends and the increasing attention from brand clients on carbon reduction and supply chain sustainability performance, Arcadyan actively addresses the challenges of carbon footprint management, energy efficiency improvement, and net-zero commitments. In 2022, Arcadyan joined the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and officially launched its long-term carbon reduction roadmap. Arcadyan has committed to reduce Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions by 50% and Scope 3 emissions by 66% compared to the base year by 2030, reduce Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 90% in 2024, and achieve net-zero emissions across all scopes by 2050.  
  
To fulfill these commitments, Arcadyan launched the "Go Green with Arcadyan" Supply Chain Carbon Reduction Project in October 2023. In the first phase, 14 high carbon emission suppliers were invited to participate, covering six major categories of key components: adapters, cables, casings, connectors, heat sinks, and printed circuit boards. The program promotes supplier carbon inventory, target setting, and carbon reduction actions to enhance climate resilience and international competitiveness.
###### Program Timeline
The "Go Green with Arcadyan" project began in October 2023 and run for one and a half years. Based on the progress of supply chain carbon management, the program is implemented in four phases:
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926162424-5.png)
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926162518-6.png)
###### Project Results
Through the "Go Green with Arcadyan" initiative, Arcadyan has helped suppliers establish carbon management capabilities and practical implementation mechanisms, enhancing their awareness of and responsiveness to climate risks and resource management issues. The results are as follows:
  * **Organizational Level (Scope 1+2):**  
Ten suppliers completed ISO 14064 organizational greenhouse gas inventory verification. Six suppliers installed solar power generation systems, and four suppliers purchased renewable energy certificates. Energy-saving measures included replacing high-energyconsuming equipment, introducing intelligent energy management systems, and implementing waste heat recovery systems. These actions achieved a total carbon reduction of 95,302 metric tons CO2e.
  * **Product Level (Scope 3):**  
Five suppliers obtained ISO 14067 certification, promoting product miniaturization, lightweight design, and the use of post-consumer recycled (PCR) materials. Packaging improvements included switching to kraft paper cards, reducing packaging material usage, adopting reusable plastic crates and cardboard box recycling, and optimizing logistics routes and loading efficiency to reduce transport-related carbon emissions. These measures resulted in a reduction of 11,106 metric tons CO2e. 
  * **Strategic Alignment:**  
Two suppliers joined the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi), aligning with international trends such as the European Union Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), sustainable procurement, and circular design.


#### Local Procurement
Arcadyan positions its Vietnam manufacturing center as a key production base and has actively promoted a local procurement strategy over the years to enhance production and supply efficiency and expand economies of scale. The major components covered include power supply units, electronic parts, electromechanical parts (such as printed circuit boards), and mechanical parts, with primary supply sources from Taiwan, China, and Vietnam. As product applications have expanded and clients demand has increased, many Taiwan-based suppliers have not only expanded their existing plants but also established manufacturing facilities in China and Vietnam to provide localized support for production needs. To reduce energy consumption and carbon emissions from long-distance transportation of raw materials and products, Arcadyan has optimized packaging design, improved material space utilization, and adopted recyclable packaging while actively supporting local procurement to reduce transportation costs and environmental impacts.
To balance operational continuity with greenhouse gas emissions management from raw material transportation, Arcadyan implements a systematic procurement management process to continuously develop local suppliers and gradually increase the proportion of local procurement. However, in 2024, following the transformation of the China manufacturing center into an operations Office with no physical manufacturing operations, the local procurement ratio for the year was 0%. Arcadyan will continue to monitor supplier expansion and relocation progress, gradually increasing the proportion of local procurement to diversify and localize its supply chain. This approach aims to strengthen supply chain resilience, enhance manufacturing efficiency, and effectively reduce the carbon footprint from raw material transportation, thereby advancing the sustainable objectives of a green supply chain.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926162959-7.png)
#### Responsible Minerals Management
To fulfill its corporate social responsibility and in response to global concerns over human rights and environmental sustainability, Arcadyan has actively supported the "Conflict-Free Minerals" initiative since 2010, promoting the investigation and management of material sources across its supply chain. Recognizing the issues of armed conflict, child labor exploitation, and environmental destruction in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and its surrounding regions, Arcadyan has established the "[Arcadyan Sustainable Procurement Policy](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/resources/documents/Arcadyan_Sustainable_Procurement_Policy.pdf)", which requires all supply chain metals to be legally sourced, compliant, and responsibly obtained, in accordance with the standards of the Responsible Minerals Initiative (RMI).
###### Arcadyan Conict Minerals Policy
  1. Prohibit conflict minerals from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and surrounding regions.
  2. Suppliers are required to sign the "Non-use Conflict Minerals Declaration" to comply with relevant environmental and social responsibility regulations.
  3. Suppliers are required to disclose the source of the metals used, such as tantalum (Ta), tin (Sn), tungsten (W) (called 3T), cobalt (Co) and gold (Au), and fill in Conflict Minerals Reporting Template (CMRT).
  4. Taking the same requirements to manage the upstream supply chain, metal suppliers in related parts and components should investigate the refinery site before purchasing.


###### Management Mechanism and Implementation Process
Following the "Responsible Minerals Initiative" (RMI) standards, Arcadyan incorporates the prohibition of conflict minerals into its "[Sustainable Procurement Policy](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/resources/documents/Arcadyan_Sustainable_Procurement_Policy.pdf)". Arcadyan clearly stipulates that suppliers must sign "[Arcadyan Supplier CSR commitment](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/resources/documents/Arcadyan_Supplier_CSR_commitment.pdf)", pledging not to directly or indirectly procure conflict minerals from Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) or surrounding regions. Suppliers must also ensure that their smelters/ refiners comply with the Responsible Minerals Assurance Process (RMAP) standards. All suppliers are required to submit the Conflict Minerals Reporting Template (CMRT) to track and manage the sources of gold (Au), tantalum (Ta), tungsten (W), tin (Sn), and cobalt (Co). In 2024, Arcadyan collected 518 CMRT reports with a 100% submission rate. The results confirmed that no conflict minerals were used within the supply chain.
To strengthen management effectiveness, Arcadyan Green Product Team regularly conducts conflict mineral analysis on key products, disassembling them to the smallest components and verifying the sources of contained metals for potential high-risk origins. Findings are documented in the Supplier Conflict Minerals Survey System, where the Green Product Department reviews supplier reports and supports documentation to ensure transparency and compliance. Since implementing responsible minerals management, Arcadyan has never experienced incidents of product returns, customer complaints, or reputational risks arising from noncompliance.
Furthermore, all suppliers are subject to regular assessments covering incoming material quality, customer complaint handling, and environmental and social responsibility performance (including conflict minerals and hazardous substances). Evaluation results serve as a basis for procurement strategy—suppliers with excellent performance are given procurement priority, while underperforming suppliers are considered for removal from the Qualified Vendor List (QVL) to ensure supply chain compliance and sustainability.
###### Responsible Minerals Training
Arcadyan conducts annual internal awareness training and organizes online briefings for suppliers, covering topics such as Arcadyan's Conflict Minerals Policy, key points in completing the Conflict Minerals Reporting Template (CMRT), and updates on international regulatory developments. Additionally, Arcadyan provides case-by-case coaching for suppliers to help them understand smelter certification processes and compliance requirements, thereby strengthening the overall responsible sourcing capabilities of the supply chain.
###### Reporting Channels and Traceability Mechanism
To ensure transparency and integrity within the supply chain, Arcadyan has established a dedicated reporting email ([ethics@arcadyan.com](http://ethics@arcadyan.com)) for suppliers, employees, and stakeholders to anonymously raise concerns regarding conflict minerals, high-risk mining areas, or human rights violations. If preliminary verification confirms the validity of a report, Arcadyan will immediately cease procurement, require the supplier to provide an explanation and corrective measures, and continue to track the progress of implementation to ensure resolution.

####  Environmental Sustainability 
# Restricted Substance Management
In light of heightened international attention on Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances (PFAS), Arcadyan began requiring suppliers to sign the Survey of Level 1 Reportable Substances PFAS Declaration in 2024. As of that year, a total of 260 declarations had been collected, achieving a 99% response rate. To enhance restricted substance management and compliance awareness across the supply chain, 80 online training and communication sessions were conducted for suppliers, resulting in a 100% training rate among key suppliers.  
In response to European regulatory controls on Mineral Oil Aromatic Hydrocarbons (MOAH) and Mineral Oil Saturated Hydrocarbons (MOSH), Arcadyan has required suppliers to sign the Declaration of Non-Use of Mineral Oil since 2023. This measure ensures that all materials and packaging comply with applicable standards, supporting global environmental protection policies. The Vietnam Manufacturing Center has implemented the QC080000 Hazardous Substance Process Management System to strengthen material testing and risk control at the source. In addition, efforts are made to develop halogen-free products and utilize conflict-free mineral sources, aiming to reduce potential risks to human health and the environment while ensuring customer health and product safety.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926165738-1.png)
Arcadyan ensures that all products comply with international environmental regulations and customer-specific requirements by fully implementing hazardous substance management and environmentally friendly design principles. As of 2024, the applicable major regulations and product compliance statuses are summarized in the following table. To maintain a competitive edge in global environmental compliance, Arcadyan continues to strengthen realtime regulatory tracking and conformity control through its internal material management systems and close collaboration with the supply chain. These efforts also actively support customers in advancing sustainable supply chain management goals.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926165849-2.png)
###### Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment Directive (WEEE)
From the product design stage, Arcadyan incorporates sustainability considerations such as customer requirements, waste reduction, and resource reuse. Environmentally friendly materials and low-pollution alternatives are actively adopted to promote design practices that reduce natural resource consumption and improve recyclability. In 2024, the total weight of recyclable materials—including paper, cardboard, wood, and plastics—used in the production and packaging of Arcadyan's major products reached 22,361 metric tons, accounting for approximately 67% of total material usage. This meets the EU WEEE Directive's product recyclability requirements. Arcadyan continues to enhance product designs focused on resource efficiency and circular economy principles, with a strong commitment to reducing environmental impact. The following green design principles are implemented:
  * Prohibit or reduce the use of hazardous chemicals, fully complying with the EU Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS) standards.
  * Design using single-type plastics to improve post-use material recycling efficiency.
  * Prioritize the use of recycled plastics and biodegradable plastics to support resource circularity.
  * Ensure compatibility between plastic materials and surface treatment technologies to facilitate material recovery.
  * Adopt structures that are easy to disassemble and recycle, streamlining end-of-life product processing.
  * Promote modular product design, allowing for easy replacement and upgrading of key components, thereby extending product lifespan and reducing electronic waste generation.


###### Promotion of TÜV Green Product Mark
To meet EU requirements on environmental performance and energy efficiency, Arcadyan has adopted the TÜV Green Product Mark since 2018. This voluntary certification assesses the product's entire life cycle—from design and manufacturing to use and disposal—focusing on energy efficiency, environmental impact, and sustainability. Certification is pursued based on customer needs and includes energy performance testing and carbon footprint verification. Certified products comply with EU directives and receive both the green label and carbon certificate, reflecting Arcadyan's commitment to environmental responsibility. The TÜV mark strengthens regulatory compliance, enhances Arcadyan's green brand image, and builds market trust through verifiable sustainability credentials.
###### Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS）
To reduce risks from electronic waste, the EU issued Directive (EU) 2015/863 as an amendment to RoHS, adding four phthalates (DEHP, BBP, DBP, DiBP) to the list of restricted substances. This enhanced controls over hazardous materials in electronic products. Arcadyan fully supports substance reduction policies. All products comply 100% with the limits set by EU RoHS Directive 2011/65/EU, with no records of customer complaints or returns due to noncompliance demonstrating strong regulatory commitment. Arcadyan has further required its supply chain partners to incorporate phthalate substances (DEHP, BBP, DBP, and DiBP) into the risk assessment of homogeneous materials. In parallel, the company has strengthened control over the sources of raw materials and components to mitigate environmental and regulatory risks at the source, ensuring continued compliance with EU regulations and other relevant requirements in target markets.
###### Substances of Very High Concern (Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals, REACH)
In line with its commitment to environmental responsibility and regulatory compliance, Arcadyan has established the Guidelines for the Management of Environmentally Hazardous Chemicals based on international environmental regulations and customer green procurement requirements. These guidelines specify restrictions on hazardous substances used in components, packaging, and auxiliary materials, supported by a comprehensive control list and monitoring mechanisms to reduce potential environmental risks in products. Since 2020, Arcadyan has complied with the EU REACH regulation by disclosing information on Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) contained in finished products. In accordance with the Substances of Concern In articles as such or in complex objects (SCIP) notification system, product information has been registered in the EU SCIP database to ensure transparency and regulatory conformity regarding SVHC content. Arcadyan also collaborates with suppliers to strengthen supply chain information management and fulfill its legal obligation to disclose SVHC information to downstream recipients. Through systematic data collection, registration, and regulatory communication mechanisms, Arcadyan is committed to ensuring the safety of final products and reinforcing customer and consumer trust.
###### Hazardous Substance Reduction Initiatives
Guided by its core commitment to environmental sustainability, Arcadyan is dedicated to providing eco-friendly, low-toxicity, and regulation-compliant electronic products. All shipped products have passed testing under the EU Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS) for restricted substances including metals (lead, cadmium, mercury, hexavalent chromium), brominated flame retardants (PBBs, PBDEs), and phthalates (DEHP, BBP, DBP, DiBP). All test results meet regulatory thresholds, ensuring full compliance with international environmental laws.
As an electronics assembly manufacturer, Arcadyan's operations do not involve high-risk sectors such as agriculture, chemical production, or heavy industry, and do not use or generate any Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs). Mercury and related substances are not used in its processes, eliminating any risk of mercury emissions. Procurement and use of materials and components strictly follow RoHS and Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH) limits. Suppliers are required to provide compliance declarations to ensure all materials are mercury-free.
Through robust supply chain management, Arcadyan enforces comprehensive source control and promotes shared green responsibility across its supplier network. Internal environmental audits are conducted regularly, and thirdparty agencies are commissioned to perform environmental emission monitoring. To date, Arcadyan has no records of violations related to POPs regulations. The company remains committed to reducing hazardous substances and developing environmentally responsible products that balance performance with sustainability, in alignment with global trends and stakeholder expectations.
###### Halogen-Free Material Management
Halogenated materials may release highly toxic substances such as dioxins when incinerated, posing serious risks to ecosystems and human health. The EU Restriction of Hazardous Substances (RoHS) Directive includes commonly used brominated flame retardants, such as PBBs and PBDEs, under strict regulation to minimize environmental and health risks during product use and disposal. In line with global “halogen-free components and processes” initiatives and customer expectations for green manufacturing, Arcadyan enforces strict source control of hazardous substances. The company has established clear environmental substance control standards that define allowable limits for chlorine and bromine content, while continuously promoting the research and substitution of halogen-free materials to enhance supply chain compliance management.
Arcadyan launched a halogen-free material assessment and substitution program in 2010, gradually phasing out high-risk substances. As of 2024, over 88% of materials used in Arcadyan products are halogen-free, while the remaining 12% remain fully compliant with environmental regulations and restrictions. The company continues to advance toward full halogen-free implementation, enhancing environmental friendliness in material selection and fulfilling its commitment to low-pollution, low-risk sustainable product design.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/26/image-20250926170506-3.png)
###### Mineral Oil-Free Material Policy
In response to growing global concerns over environmental protection and consumer health, Arcadyan has proactively aligned with EU regulations on mineral oil content by establishing a clear Mineral Oil-Free Material Policy. This policy aims to reduce the release of substances with potential risks to human health and the environment throughout the product life cycle. Mineral oils and their derivatives—such as Mineral Oil Aromatic Hydrocarbons (MOAH) and Mineral Oil Saturated Hydrocarbons (MOSH)—are known for their persistence and bioaccumulation potential, and studies have indicated possible hazards to ecosystems and human health. Since 2023, Arcadyan has prohibited the use of mineral oil-containing substances in product packaging, printed materials (including boxes, manuals, and brochures), and related components. The following management mechanisms have been implemented to ensure policy compliance:
  * **Strengthened Supply Chain Management：**  
All packaging and printing suppliers are required to sign a Declaration of Non-Use of Mineral Oil to collectively uphold environmental standards.
  * **Raw Material Review and Verication:**  
A source audit mechanism has been established for raw materials. Suppliers may be required to submit third-party test reports based on risk assessment. In 2024, a 100% report collection rate was achieved.
  * **Internal Training and Awareness:**  
The policy has been integrated into environmental and compliance training programs to enhance employee awareness of environmental regulations, internal requirements, and corporate responsibility.
  * **Ongoing Monitoring and Optimization:**  
Regulatory updates are continuously tracked, and current material usage is reviewed to optimize green material procurement strategies and substitution plans.


Arcadyan will continue to reinforce its mineral oil-free material management system to reduce chemical risks and promote environmentally responsible, health-conscious, and legally compliant sustainable product development.

####  Happy Workplace 
# Employee Salaries and Benefits
#### Remuneration and Benets
Arcadyan's compensation policy is fair, transparent, and motivational, with a comprehensive system designed to ensure our pay is both competitive and compliant with all regulations. We allocate at least 5% of our pre-tax net profit as employee bonuses to share our operational success and foster mutual growth between our employees and the company.
All Arcadyan employees are entitled to basic protections as mandated by law, including labor and health insurance, and pension plans. We also implement the principle of fair compensation, ensuring salary treatment is not affected by factors such as race, nationality, age, social class, descent, religious belief, physical or mental disability, gender, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, marital status, or political affiliation. This commitment ensures that all employees can develop their full potential in a respectful and equitable work environment.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924163238-1.png)
###### Living Wage Commitment
Recognizing the growing focus on global social responsibility, Arcadyan believes that fair and competitive compensation is fundamental to employee well-being and sustainable growth. To that end, we are committed to providing all employees with a living wage—a salary sufficient to cover their basic needs. This commitment helps us enhance job satisfaction, respect labor dignity, and promote organizational cohesion and a positive social impact.
In continuous efforts to optimize our compensation policies, Arcadyan references the living wage definition from international organizations such as the Global Living Wage Coalition (GLWC) and the Fair Labour Association (FLA). We apply their principle—that a living wage should be sufficient to cover basic living expenses, including food, housing, healthcare, education, and savings—and align with UN Sustainable Development Goal "SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth." Accordingly, we regularly review and adjust our compensation structure based on local minimum wage, cost of living, and inflation rates. To ensure our compensation system meets local economic conditions and employees' basic needs, we have also established the "[Arcadyan Technology Living Wage Commitment](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/resources/documents/Living_Wage_Commitment.pdf)."
In a commitment to fair pay and decent work, Arcadyan initiated a living wage review in 2024 at both its headquarters and the Vietnam Manufacturing Center, encompassing roughly 94.4% of our employees. The review established a living wage benchmark based on the local cost of living in key locations such as Taipei, Hsinchu, and Hanoi, ensuring it is sufficient to support the basic needs of employees and their families.
The review found that all employees at our Vietnam Manufacturing Center meet the local living wage benchmark, demonstrating our commitment to fair compensation at our overseas sites. In Taiwan, however, 0.8% of employees (8 people) did not yet meet this benchmark. This was primarily due to the limited work experience and market conditions of newly hired administrative support staff.
Arcadyan is committed to ensuring that all employee salaries exceed the local living wage standard by 2028, and will publicly disclose our progress. We will regularly optimize our compensation system to ensure all employees receive fair compensation, enabling them to achieve a dignified and high-quality life.
###### Retirement System
Arcadyan is committed to protecting employees' retirement rights. We ensure sufficient pension contributions and financial stability through a Retirement Supervisory Committee, established regulations, and annual actuarial calculations by external professionals. In Taiwan, we adhere to the Labor Pension Act by contributing 2% of salaries for employees under the old system (with cumulative contributions of NT$154,626 thousand as of yearend 2024) and 6% for those under the new system. For our overseas manufacturing sites, we follow local regulations, contributing 16% of salaries in China and 14% in Vietnam.
In 2024, the total pension expense recognized by subsidiaries within Arcadyan's consolidated financial statements was NT 99,231 thousand. Labor and health insurance costs combined with employee welfare expenses totaled NT 358,330 thousand. These figures reflect the company's management and implementation of retirement responsibilities, as well as our ongoing commitment and investment in employee wellbeing.
#### Diverse Employee Benefits

###### Supportive Parenting Measures
Arcadyan promotes a people-oriented human resources policy, strengthening family support initiatives and focusing on work-life balance for our employees. In response to government policies to encourage childbirth and support Taiwan's population growth,  
Arcadyan headquarters established a childbirth bonus system starting in 2011, providing eligible employees with an NT$66,000 subsidy for each newborn. As of 2024, a total of 364 newborns have benefited from this program, with cumulative bonuses reaching  
NT24,024 thousand, which reflects the company's ongoing commitment to family values and demographic issues.
In addition to financial support, Arcadyan partners with childcare and preschool institutions to offer employees diverse and subsidized services. These initiatives reduce the childcare burden, improve quality of life, and help employees achieve a balance  
between their family and professional lives, realizing the dual goals of a happy workplace and enhanced productivity.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924170708-5.png)
###### Recognition of Senior and Outstanding Employees
Arcadyan values employees' long-term commitment and exceptional contributions. Through a recognition program, we acknowledge their performance throughout their careers and foster a positive and motivational corporate culture. To enhance employees' sense of honor and belonging, Arcadyan headquarters holds an annual recognition event for  
"Senior Employees" and "Outstanding Employees." Outstanding employees are nominated by their departments and selected through a comprehensive review by senior management. Their individual value and contributions are honored at a public awards ceremony, which encourages employees to utilize their expertise for stable growth and promotes the  
continuous deepening of a positive workplace culture.

# Talent Cultivation and Development
Arcadyan, guided by the values of “Innovation, Harmony, Excellence, and Service,” fosters a culture of continuous learning to enhance adaptability and resilience. We provide diverse career and learning opportunities through three core talent development  
strategies, supporting both individual growth and organizational competitiveness.
  * Encourage internal talent development and cross-departmental collaboration.
  * Regularly review and enhance talent development programs to ensure alignment with corporate strategy and market trends.
  * Build a work environment that supports innovation and learning.


###### Training and Development Initiatives
Arcadyan allocates an annual training budget to strengthen employee skills and team effectiveness. Programs are aligned with  
operational goals and competency needs, supplemented by courses from external institutions. These initiatives help employees build expertise and innovation capacity, supporting the company’s longterm competitiveness.
Arcadyan has developed a tiered training blueprint for all employees, from new hires to senior management, with clear learning paths and career development support. We also promote intergenerational learning to strengthen teamwork and organizational cohesion.
###### Training Roadmap
To systematically drive talent development and strengthen our talent competitiveness, Arcadyan headquarters has established key performance indicators. These are used to evaluate training effectiveness and continuously optimize our learning system. The key indicators are as follows:
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924173118-1.png)
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924173303-2.png)
Since 2016, Arcadyan has offered over 696 courses, including 499 professional courses, covering diverse fields from R&D technology to finance and accounting. This robust training framework is aimed at strengthening our talent competitiveness, as demonstrated by the 99.7% of employees who participated in work or career development-related training in 2024.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924173614-3.png)![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924173651-4.png)
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924175416-1.png)
###### Learning and Knowledge Sharing Platform
Arcadyan has established an internal online knowledge-sharing platform, the "Arcadyan Content Sharing System (CSS)," where employees serve as internal instructors to share their professional knowledge and practical experience. The course content covers diverse areas, including general knowledge, software  
and hardware technical training, new hire education, and management skills development. As of 2024, the platform has cumulatively offered 1,190 online courses. Employees can browse course materials and video files on demand through the company's internal network to promote knowledge exchange and crossdisciplinary learning among departments.
The CSS platform streamlines internal resources and knowledge management, boosting the efficiency of knowledge transfer and retention. This digital platform empowers employees with flexible, self-paced learning, which in turn strengthens our corporate learning culture. The initiative cultivates talent with the agility to respond to change and innovate, meeting the demands of the modern workplace.
###### Company-wide Awareness Training
To deepen our corporate sustainability culture, Arcadyan provides company-wide sustainability awareness training covering the three dimensions of ESG. The curriculum links our company's strategy to the latest industry trends, enhancing employee awareness and practical skills. In 2024, the training achieved a 100% completion rate for new hires and a 95.5% completion rate (3,534 employees) for refresher training among existing staff. The sustainability awareness training curriculum includes:
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/24/image-20250924180015-2.png)
###### Building Climate Change Resilience
To enhance employee understanding and resilience to climate change, Arcadyan integrates related topics into its annual sustainability awareness training. The curriculum covers global net-zero trends, Arcadyan's carbon reduction strategies, and operational environmental risks. This training serves as a foundational course to strengthen organizational resilience and promote sustainable development, helping employees cope with the pressures of transition and uncertainty.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925110917-1.png)
###### Management Courses for Female Executives
Arcadyan believes gender shouldn't be a barrier to professional growth, particularly in STEM. To support women in management, we launched a dedicated training program for female executives in 2023. The program, led by experienced instructors, helps women navigate challenges like work-life balance and leadership styles. A peer network also builds confidence and influence, promoting gender equality in the workplace. This initiative supports SDG 5: Gender Equality by providing equal development opportunities, creating a more inclusive and resilient workplace.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925111753-2.png)

###  幸福職場 
####  Happy Workplace 
# Occupational Health and Safety Management
#### Occupational Health and Safety Management System
With a "people-first" core philosophy, Arcadyan prioritizes employee health and safety by creating a safe, comfortable, and ergonomic work environment. We have established safety management procedures at all operating sites to prevent occupational hazards. Through risk assessments and controls, we ensure workplace safety is effectively managed, mitigating potential risks to our employees' wellbeing.
Since 2005, Arcadyan has implemented the ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management System and a comprehensive  
"Environmental Health and Safety Policy." This framework establishes detailed safety procedures and audit mechanisms, promoting a "zero-accident" workplace through continuous improvement and full employee participation. This commitment ensures employee  
well-being and strengthens the foundation for our sustainabledevelopment.
###### ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management Policy
  * Comply with domestic environmental, safety and health, and energy regulations and effectively implement the environmental, safety and health management system.
  * Promote education and publicity on environmental safety, energy and product eco-design.
  * Implement employee health management, proactively prevent occupational disasters, and create a safe workplace with zero disasters.


To build a safe, healthy, and sustainable workplace, Arcadyan has established the following core guidelines to implement its Occupational Health and Safety Policy and promote a strong safety culture:
  * Provide a safe, healthy, and protective work environment for all personnel within our operational scope, including employees, suppliers, contractors, and partners, to prevent occupational accidents.
  * Comply fully with relevant international standards, local regulations, and other applicable occupational health and safety norms to ensure compliance and management effectiveness.
  * Maintain the ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management System, regularly conducting risk identification and hazard assessments to systematically control potential risks.
  * Pursue a long-term vision of "zero accidents," by planning specific short-, medium-, and long-term safety goals and action plans to continuously optimize management practices.
  * Promote a comprehensive workplace health management system that strengthens the prevention of occupational illnesses and injuries, and implements health promotion initiatives to protect employees' physical and mental well-being.
  * Provide comprehensive safety and health education and training and communication channels. We establish mechanisms for employee participation to strengthen everyone's awareness and sense of responsibility for occupational health and safety management.
  * Actively collaborate and communicate with internal and external stakeholders to promote shared safety and health values, creating a sustainable workplace together.


#### Occupational Hazard Identication and Risk Assessment
Arcadyan follows its ISO 45001-compliant 'Environmental Aspects and Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment Management Operating Procedure.' Using a Safety and Health Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment Form, we implement a scoring system based on three indicators—severity, frequency, and probability—to determine risk levels. High-risk issues are prioritized with specific improvement actions and continuous monitoring, while medium and low-risk items are managed through regular inspections and  
standardized controls to ensure a safe workplace.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925133734-1.png)![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925133846-2.png)
###### Operating Procedure for Occupational Health and Safety Hazard Identication, Risk Assessment, and Control
Arcadyan maintains a secure work environment through proactive hazard identification, risk assessment, and continuous monitoring. In 2024, we conducted comprehensive safety evaluations at our headquarters and Vietnam manufacturing center, covering 94.3% of employees. This systematic approach identified key risks and established targeted improvement plans, ensuring all workplace hazards remain controllable and our teams can work safely and confidently.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925134457-3.png)
###### Occupational Safety Risk List
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925134628-5.png)
###### Workplace Environment Monitoring and Management
Across all global sites, Arcadyan maintains a dedicated department for workplace environment management. In accordance with our "Environmental, Health and Safety, and Energy Monitoring and Measurement Management Procedure," we conduct regular inspections and repairs to mitigate health and safety risks. Our monitoring covers a range of potential hazards and equipment, including:
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925134807-6.png)
#### Health Care and Promotion
To support employee well-being as a driver of sustainable growth, Arcadyan's Taiwan headquarters operates a Health Center. Staffed by professional medical personnel and partnered with contracted institutions, the center provides comprehensive health services. Our strategy is built on three pillars: Health Education, Health Promotion, and Health Management, with the following measures:
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925135228-7.png)
###### Female Employee Care and Support Measures
With over 2,000 female employees across its global operating sites, Arcadyan provides diverse and comprehensive care measures to support their physical and mental health and work needs at different stages of their lives. This commitment aims to create a friendly workplace, promote a balance between career and family, and fulfill our sustainable commitment to gender equality and a healthy workplace.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925140419-8.png)
###### Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
To support employees facing diverse challenges and stress in their lives, Arcadyan launched the professional, confidential, and supportive Employee Assistance Program (EAP) in 2024. The program offers a wide range of consulting services on topics such as mental health, family issues, financial management, and legal advice, all provided by professionals with strict privacy. The fact that 28 employees utilized the service in 2024 demonstrates a growing emphasis on mental health and the tangible impact of our support mechanism. Arcadyan is committed to continuously enhancing the EAP, deepening our employee care efforts, and fostering a healthy and supportive workplace culture.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925140647-9.png)
###### Health Promotion Activities
Arcadyan continuously promotes employee well-being through health seminars and activities. We also regularly publish health information on our internal electronic bulletin board (BBS) to enhance health awareness and self-care abilities.
In 2024, Arcadyan headquarters organized 12 health seminars and 3 health-related activities, which covered topics such as health care, nutrition management, and mental health. These events provided practical and relevant health education content, with a total of 809 participants and a 92% participation rate, reflecting high employee engagement with health-related topics.
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2025/09/25/image-20250925141008-10.png)

# Annual Results
Arcadyan has established the "Corporate Social Committee" (hereinafter referred to as the CSR Committee) within the "Social Participation Implementation Group" under the "Sustainable Development Committee." It collaborates with group enterprises and social welfare organizations to promote various social welfare activities. The CSR Committee formulates a social participation plan every year and holds various lectures and experiential activities to assist colleagues in implementing corporate social responsibilities in their daily lives. Arcadyan actively participates in numerous public welfare activities, gives back to society, and contributes to corporate social responsibility.

#### Arcadyan Steps into Fields of Hope with “Waiting Angels” — Sowing Care, Reaping Wellness
Arcadyan has supported the “Waiting Angels” initiative for many years. In 2025, the company took it further by inviting employees and their families to help cultivate and manage organic rice fields at Yoga Farm, which supports orphanages. This joint effort provides healthier meals for children and reflects Arcadyan’s commitment to environmental sustainability and social responsibility.
2025/ 06/ 09

#### 2024 Arcadyan Coastal Cleanup: Taking Action to Protect Our Oceans
In 2024, Arcadyan continued its commitment to International Coastal Cleanup Day on the third Saturday of September. On September 21, 51 employees and their families participated in the cleanup at a beach in Miaoli organized by the Society of Wilderness, demonstrating their dedication to protecting the oceans, even in heavy rain.

#### 2024 Summer Camp for English Learning program
Arcadyan hosted the "Arcadyan Intelligent English Learning Program" summer camp, taking 12 students from a rural school to summer camp in the Philippines. The students had cultural exchanges and ecological adventures with their local classmates, and communicated in English to improve the effectiveness of language learning, and leave precious memories in cross-cultural interactions.

# Arcadyan Tops Financial Times’ 2025 Asia-Pacific Climate Leaders, Advancing Global Sustainability Through Decarbonization
2025 / 06 / 23 
![Arcadyan Tops Financial Times’ 2025 Asia-Pacific Climate Leaders, Advancing Global Sustainability Through Decarbonization](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/%E9%87%91%E8%9E%8D%E6%99%82%E5%A0%B12_u4C2C3f.jpg)
Arcadyan has been listed as the top company on the **2025 Asia-Pacific Climate Leaders** list, jointly compiled by the _Financial Times_ and global data firm Statista, recognizing its outstanding performance in climate action and carbon management. This honor not only recognizes Arcadyan’s efforts in sustainable carbon reduction but also highlights the key influence of Taiwanese enterprises in the global low-carbon transition.
The award evaluation focused on the **core carbon emissions intensity** (Scope 1 and 2 emissions relative to revenue) from 2018 to 2023, along with performance indicators such as **climate disclosures to CDP** , **energy transparency** , and **sustainability reporting**. Among more than 2,000 candidate companies, Arcadyan stood out for its exceptional emissions reduction results, ranking first among all Taiwanese companies.
* * *
**Accelerating Decarbonization Through Supply Chain and Transport Optimization**
Arcadyan has long been dedicated to addressing climate change and has implemented the following key initiatives to significantly reduce its operational carbon footprint and improve energy efficiency:
  * **Green energy adoption** : Installed solar energy systems and smart energy management solutions at major sites to accelerate renewable energy deployment.
  * **Low-carbon transport transformation** : Optimized logistics strategies by partnering with transport providers capable of carbon tracking, improving logistics efficiency and reducing emissions.
  * **Supply chain decarbonization collaboration** : Partnered with suppliers to implement carbon reduction programs, including emissions inventory and sustainability training, to build a greener supply network.


These actions have led to a substantial reduction in Arcadyan’s core carbon emissions intensity (Scope 1+2), earning it a leading position in this year’s climate leadership evaluation.
* * *
**A Long-Term Commitment to a Sustainable Future**
In response to growing climate challenges and international sustainability trends, Arcadyan has set multiple mid- and long-term goals, including:
  * **Science-based targets (SBTi)** : Committed to reducing annual carbon emissions by 6.25% on average through 2030 and achieving net-zero emissions across operations by 2040.
  * **Comprehensive supply chain carbon management** : Expanded carbon inventory mechanisms to Tier 1 and Tier 2 suppliers, strengthening transparency in emissions disclosure.
  * **Low-carbon product transition** : Introduced product carbon footprint assessments and optimized packaging design to promote low-carbon and circular product strategies.
  * **International ESG recognition** : Actively engaged in ESG evaluations and global initiatives, earning the **EcoVadis Platinum rating (top 1% globally)** for its outstanding performance in environmental, social, and governance aspects.


* * *
Arcadyan’s recognition as the top Asia-Pacific Climate Leader by the _Financial Times_ is a testament to its impactful decarbonization efforts. Looking ahead, Arcadyan will continue to deepen its climate strategies and accelerate green innovation, leveraging technology to expand its sustainability impact and play a vital role in the global net-zero transition.
_Source:_[ Asia-Pacific Climate Leaders 2025: the interactive listing](https://www.ft.com/content/37330039-b77b-4ade-b52b-2bea37e34416)

# Arcadyan Awarded 2025 EcoVadis Platinum Rating, Recognized Top 1% of Global Companies for Sustainability Performance
2025 / 05 / 20 
![Arcadyan Awarded 2025 EcoVadis Platinum Rating, Recognized Top 1% of Global Companies for Sustainability Performance](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/%E6%8A%95%E5%BD%B1%E7%89%871_VkNJnfA.JPG)
Arcadyan has once again achieved the highest distinction in the **2025 EcoVadis Sustainability Rating** , receiving the **Platinum Medal** for its outstanding performance in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) practices. This places Arcadyan among the **top 1% of all companies evaluated globally** , underscoring our ongoing commitment to sustainable development and responsible business practices.
**EcoVadis** is the world’s leading sustainability assessment platform, evaluating over **150,000 companies** across more than **250 industries** and **185 countries**. The assessment is based on globally recognized standards and covers **four core areas** : **Environment, Labor & Human Rights, Ethics**, and **Sustainable Procurement**. The results serve as a trusted reference for global customers to assess suppliers’ ESG performance.
At Arcadyan, we integrate sustainability into every aspect of our business.
  * On the **environmental** front, Arcadyan actively drives **climate action** and the **low-carbon transition** through eco-design innovation and product responsibility. In 2024, Arcadyan officially received validation of our carbon reduction targets from the **Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)**. Arcadyan are also accelerating our **energy transition** and increasing our use of **renewable energy sources**.
  * Within our **supply chain** , Arcadyan extend our sustainability strategy by engaging with suppliers through initiatives such as the **“Go Green with Arcadyan”** program, launched in 2023, promoting carbon footprint verification and certifications including **ISO 14064** and **ISO 14067**.


We are equally committed to **social responsibility**. Arcadyan promotes **living wage practices** , maintains a **fair and transparent compensation system** , and fosters a **safe, inclusive, and diverse workplace** for all employees. 
This recognition by EcoVadis reaffirms our dedication to building a resilient and responsible organization. Arcadyan will continue to enhance ESG transparency, strengthen stakeholder engagement, and innovate for a better, more sustainable future.

# Arcadyan has been selected for TIME magazine's "World's Best Companies in Sustainable Growth 2025"
2024 / 12 / 27 
![Arcadyan has been selected for TIME magazine's "World's Best Companies in Sustainable Growth 2025"](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/%E7%B0%A1%E5%A0%B16.jpg)
Arcadyan has achieved another milestone on its journey towards sustainable development, being honored with the prestigious title of "World's Best Companies in Sustainable Growth 2025" by TIME Magazine and the international online database Statista. With a total score of 74.75, Arcadyan has been selected among the top 500 companies worldwide, showcasing its outstanding performance and unwavering commitment to sustainability.
TIME Magazine has launched the inaugural "World's Best Companies in Sustainable Growth" to recognize companies excelling in both financial and environmental performance. The evaluation process utilized publicly available corporate information and third-party environmental data, assessing companies based on three key dimensions: revenue growth, financial stability, and environmental impact.
In 2023, Arcadyan's revenue surpassed NT$50 billion, marking six consecutive years of record-breaking growth. With a clear blueprint for network communication technology and products, Arcadyan has achieved stable profitability and maintained a leading technological position, demonstrating the compatibility of sustainable development and corporate growth. In terms of environmental protection, Arcadyan passed the SBTi science-based reduction target review in 2024, committing to an absolute reduction of 90% in Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions by 2040, and a 98% reduction in Scope 3 carbon emissions per unit of gross profit by 2050. By 2023, Arcadyan had already achieved a 20.1% absolute reduction in Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions and a 14.5% reduction in Scope 3 carbon emission intensity. To further expand its sustainable impact, Arcadyan launched the "Go Green with Arcadyan" supplier carbon reduction project in 2023, achieving a reduction of 95,302 tons of carbon emissions from organizational initiatives and 11,106 tons from product initiatives by 2024, collectively working towards sustainability goals.
Being selected as one of the "World's Best Companies in Sustainable Growth 500" is not only a recognition of Arcadyan's achievements but also an encouragement to continue promoting sustainable development. Arcadyan will persist in developing environmentally friendly products, striving for revenue growth while ensuring environmental benefits, achieving a win-win situation.
Source: [World’s Best Companies in Sustainable Growth 2025 | TIME](https://time.com/collection/worlds-best-companies-sustainable-growth-2025/)

# Arcadyan scored B Management Level in Climate Change, Water and Forest by CDP
2025 / 04 / 17 
![Arcadyan scored B Management Level in Climate Change, Water and Forest by CDP](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/CDP3_0HQ0KRx.jpg)
Arcadyan participated in 2024 Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP) evaluation and was rated B_ Management Level in the "Climate Change", "Water", and "Forest" projects, demonstrating Arcadyan's active actions and transparent disclosure in climate governance.
The CDP focuses on the disclosure of corporate greenhouse gas emissions information and its management measures for climate change risks and opportunities. In 2024, the number of companies participating in the CDP assessment worldwide exceeded 25,000, and the number of participating companies in Taiwan has reached more than 700, with an annual growth rate of more than 12%, indicating that the importance of climate issues in the industrial chain continues to increase.
Arcadyan continues to address the challenges of climate change with a forward-looking perspective and actively responds to international initiatives and actions. In addition to designing products from a circular economic perspective, Arcadyan also promotes carbon reduction from multiple aspects such as processes, operations and supply chains. In 2023, Arcadyan officially set the Science Based Targets (SBTi), taking 2022 as the base year, Arcadyan commit to achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions (Scope 1 and Scope 2) within the organization by 2040, and net zero indirect emissions (Scope 3) outside the organization by 2050.
To enhance climate resilience and carbon reduction capabilities, Arcadyan formulated a diverse and comprehensive climate action strategy, including introducing ISO 50001 Energy Management System, increasing the use of renewable energy, developing low-carbon and energy-efficient products, introducing low-carbon transportation routes, and strengthening low-carbon supply chain management. Among them, Arcadyan promoted "Go Green with Arcadyan" project and worked with 14 suppliers to implement carbon management. Through specific actions such as product carbon footprint inventory, packaging material optimization, and logistics carbon reduction, it achieved organizational carbon reduction of 95,302 tons CO2e and product carbon reduction of 11,106 tons CO2e in 2024, significantly improving the Arcadyan’s greenhouse gas reduction performance in Scope 3.
By continuously improving energy efficiency and combining core technologies with innovative designs, Arcadyan is committed to reducing greenhouse gases and contributing to global climate sustainability.

# Arcadyan Technology Focuses on Sustainability, Wins the “Top 100 Taiwanese Sustainable Corporates Award” for Two Consecutive Years
2024 / 12 / 11 
![Arcadyan Technology Focuses on Sustainability, Wins the “Top 100 Taiwanese Sustainable Corporates Award” for Two Consecutive Years](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/20241211_01_4X8fDwP.jpg)
On December 11, 2024, Arcadyan, represented by Executive Vice President Mike Lu, was once again honored with two prestigious awards: the "Top 100 Taiwanese Sustainable Corporates Award" and the "Corporate Sustainability Reports Award - Silver Level." These accolades highlight Arcadyan's outstanding achievements in the field of sustainability. Organized by the Taiwan Institute for Sustainable Energy (TAISE), the Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Awards (TCSA )have seen participation from 882 companies over the years, collectively accounting for 85.8% of the total market value of listed companies in Taiwan, underscoring the growing focus on corporate sustainability.  
  
Arcadyan was awarded the 2024 India Circular Economy Technology Award on July 12, 2024, at the India Circular Economy Forum (ICEF) in New Delhi, India, in recognition of its outstanding contributions to the circular economy through innovative green product development.  
  
In 2024, Arcadyan had its short-term carbon reduction and long-term net-zero targets validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi). The company actively expanded the high-power solar photovoltaic system at its Vietnam production center, significantly increasing renewable energy usage. The Taiwan headquarters is also on track to complete the construction of its solar power system by 2026, further supporting its low-carbon operational goals.  
  
Arcadyan remains dedicated to fostering sustainable supply chains through its “Go Green with Arcadyan” program. By systematically guiding suppliers in greenhouse gas inventories and product carbon footprint reduction, the company promotes sustainability across the entire supply chain, solidifying its leadership role within the industry ecosystem.  
  
Standing out among numerous participating companies, Arcadyan’s achievements reflect its steadfast dedication to sustainability and provide a strong foundation for its future initiatives. Moving forward, Arcadyan will continue to leverage its innovative strengths and professional expertise, working with partners to create a brighter, more sustainable future.

# Arcadyan’s Carbon Reduction and Net-zero Target Approved by SBTi
2024 / 07 / 12 
![Arcadyan’s Carbon Reduction and Net-zero Target Approved by SBTi](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/SBTi_U1CTrnT.png)
In the generation of rapid growth in AI and digital transformation, Arcadyan plays an important role in the transformation process. In the face of the impact of climate change, Arcadyan actively participates in international initiatives and the use of renewable energy that customers concern and strives to move towards the goal of net zero. Arcadyan signed the commitment of the SBTi science-based reduction target initiative in 2022, taking science-based methodology to set net-zero carbon reduction targets and plans a carbon reduction action blueprint to track and manage Arcadyan's carbon assets in a systematic way. In addition, Arcadyan also actively responds to the RE100 initiative, purchasing renewable energy certificates every year, and is committed to using 100% renewable energy in 2030 to achieve environmental sustainability.  
  
Arcadyan submitted its carbon reduction target at the end of 2023 and approved by SBTi in July 2024. The SBTi official website announced that Arcadyan set 2022 as the base year, and the greenhouse gas (Scope 1+2) within the organization will reach the net-zero emission target in 2040, the short-term goal is set as an absolute reduction of 50% in 2030. Other indirect emissions of greenhouse gases (Scope 3) also plan to reach net-zero emission targets in 2050, with a short-term target set intensity reduction of 66% in 2030.  
  
Arcadyan tracks and reviews carbon reduction performance progress every quarter, and flexibly adjust carbon reduction action plans based on market and technological development trends to ensure that it meets customer expectations and achieves organizational and product decarbonization goals. Arcadyan is committed to information transparency and discloses Arcadyan Group's carbon emissions and target progress in its sustainability report every year to implement Arcadyan's best practices in carbon reduction actions and corporate value.  
  
![](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/uploads/2024/07/12/image-20240712142806-1.png)
SBTi official website: <https://sciencebasedtargets.org/companies-taking-action>

# Arcadyan Vietnam Manufacturing Center completed RBA VAP, Achieving Platinum Status.
2024 / 05 / 10 
![Arcadyan Vietnam Manufacturing Center completed RBA VAP, Achieving Platinum Status.](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/RBA_VAP%E7%B8%AE%E5%9C%96.png)
Arcadyan Vietnam Manufacturing Center (AVC) completed RBA VAP Validated Audit Process (VAP) and achieved Platinum Status in May 2024.
The Responsible Business Alliance (RBA), formerly known as the Electronic Industry Citizenship Coalition (EICC), is the largest corporate social responsibility alliance in the global industrial supply chain. The RBA Code of Conduct aims to protect workers in the supply chain, guaranteeing safe, dignified, and respected working environments, and ensuring that supplier operations comply with environmental standards and business ethics. The RBA VAP assesses companies' performance in corporate social responsibility in five dimensions: human rights, health and safety, environment, ethical standards, and management systems.
Arcadyan adheres to international labor-related human rights standards by establishing the "Arcadyan Human Rights Policy Declaration" to promote human rights risk management. Regular risk identification, prevention, and improvement initiatives are conducted to safeguard employees' labor rights. Both the Arcadyan headquarters and the AVC have obtained certifications in ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management System and ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, and conduct greenhouse gas inventories and monitoring annually. In terms of operations, Arcadyan upholds the principle of integrity management, establishing good corporate governance and risk control mechanisms, implementing integrity management from four dimensions: "policy formulation," "education and training," "prevention and deterrence," and "complaint reporting." The recent RBA VAP result demonstrates Arcadyan's commitment to social responsibilities such as employees’ welfare, the environment, and business ethics.
Arcadyan will continue to adhere to the RBA Code of Conduct and stakeholders' expectations, implement corporate social responsibility, and drive value chain partners through supplier development programs, strengthening risk management and resilience in the upstream and downstream supply chains.

# Arcadyan Receives National Sustainable Development Award
2023 / 11 / 30 
![Arcadyan Receives National Sustainable Development Award](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/JR6_1137.JPG)
On November 30th, Arcadyan was awarded the 2023 National Sustainable Development Award, presented by Premier Chien-jen Chen, with Vice President Raymond Hsiung accepted the award on behalf of Arcadyan.
The National Sustainable Development Award, organized by the National Council for Sustainable Development of the Executive Yuan in Taiwan, aims to recognize organizations' outstanding performance in sustainable development. Arcadyan's recognition stands out among numerous participating organizations, highlighting the national-level acknowledgment of Arcadyan's sustainable development strategies and achievements.
With the vision of "Create a Better Future through Networking," Arcadyan has developed three major sustainability pillars: Equilibrium, Prosperity & Inclusivity (EPI). These are further extended into eight dimensions, including Green Design, Sustainable Procurement, Climate Action, Integrity Governance, Labor Rights, Diversity and Inclusion, Rural Education, and Support for the Underprivileged. These initiatives align with Taiwan's Sustainable Development Goals and Taiwan’s Pathway to Net-Zero Emissions in 2050.
In response to global climate action, Arcadyan joined the SBTi (Science-Based Targets initiative) in 2022 to establish progressive carbon reduction goals. In recent years, the company has consistently strengthened sustainability in areas such as product design, raw material procurement, and manufacturing. This includes continuously increasing the application of Post-consumer Recycled (PCR) plastic in products, evaluating the use of bio-based materials with lower environmental impact, expanding the installation of solar energy systems in factories to accelerate the transition to a low-carbon business model, and purchasing renewable energy certificates to increase the proportion of renewable energy use. In addition to these actions, Arcadyan leverages its corporate sustainability influence, launching the "Go Green with Arcadyan" project in 2023. This initiative systematically assists supply chain partners in organizational level greenhouse gas and product carbon footprint inventories and reductions, leading the supply chain towards a green and low-carbon transformation.
2023 has been a fruitful year for Arcadyan in terms of sustainability achievements. Arcadyan received the "Top 100 Taiwanese Sustainable Corporates Award" and the "Corporate Sustainability Reporting Award - Silver Level" at the 2023 Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Awards, as well as the recognition of the "Outstanding Product Award" at the 2023 Taiwan Circular Economy Awards."

# Arcadyan Earns TCSA “Top 100 Sustainable Exemplary Enterprise” Honor for Third Consecutive Year
2025 / 11 / 26 
![Arcadyan Earns TCSA “Top 100 Sustainable Exemplary Enterprise” Honor for Third Consecutive Year](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/IMG_1538_9jk69TJ.jpg)
Arcadyan has once again demonstrated its strong commitment to environmental sustainability, social inclusion, and corporate governance by receiving two major honors at the **2025 Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Awards (TCSA)** : the _Taiwan Top 100 Sustainable Exemplary Enterprises Award_ and the _Gold Award for Sustainability Reporting_. These recognitions reaffirm Arcadyan’s long-term efforts and outstanding achievements under Taiwan’s most reputable ESG evaluation framework.
Hosted by the Taiwan Institute for Sustainable Energy, TCSA is one of Taiwan’s most credible ESG award mechanisms, evaluated against international Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) standards. The assessment covers multiple dimensions, including sustainability governance, climate action, supply chain management, and stakeholder engagement.
**Recognized as a Top 100 Sustainable Enterprise: Comprehensive ESG Implementation**
Arcadyan has consistently advanced environmental sustainability and low-carbon transformation by establishing energy-saving processes, improving energy efficiency, fulfilling its SBTi-aligned science-based emissions reduction targets, and strengthening ESG management across its supply chain. In governance and social performance, the company continues to enhance workplace well-being, occupational health and safety, diversity and inclusion, and talent development, while actively contributing to community engagement, education initiatives, and social impact programs—earning strong recognition from the judging committee.
**Gold Award for Sustainability Reporting: Transparent and Comprehensive ESG Disclosure**
Arcadyan’s 2024 Sustainability Report adheres to a high standard of transparency, fully disclosing the company’s policies, governance structure, risk management, materiality assessment, and annual performance across the four ESG pillars. The report is aligned with international reporting frameworks and complemented by a dedicated ESG website that enhances stakeholder communication and accessibility—meeting TCSA’s criteria for completeness, credibility, and clarity of disclosure.
Looking ahead, Arcadyan will continue to position sustainability as a core driver of business strategy, leveraging technological innovation and responsible operations to accelerate global green transformation, expand positive social impact, and advance its long-term vision for corporate sustainability.

# Arcadyan Named to Business Weekly's "Carbon Competitiveness Top 100" for Second Consecutive Year
2025 / 11 / 21 
![Arcadyan Named to Business Weekly's "Carbon Competitiveness Top 100" for Second Consecutive Year](https://csr.arcadyan.com/media/%E7%B0%A1%E5%A0%B12_udVFJ17.JPG)
Arcadyan has been honored as one of Business Weekly's "Carbon Competitiveness Top 100" companies for two consecutive years in 2025. "Carbon Competitiveness" is Taiwan's first corporate evaluation framework centered on carbon performance, utilizing publicly available corporate data that covers key indicators including carbon emission reduction rates, carbon productivity growth rates, decarbonization commitment levels, decision-making hierarchy, and Scope 3 emissions disclosure to comprehensively assess the depth and breadth of corporate carbon reduction initiatives.
In response to global net-zero trends, Arcadyan has integrated carbon reduction into its core strategy. Both Taiwan headquarters and Vietnam manufacturing center established systematic energy and carbon management, while the 2023 "Go Green with Arcadyan" initiative engaged suppliers in carbon inventory and reduction targets, achieving 95,302 tons CO₂e Scope 3 reduction annually. Product innovations include recycled plastics and intelligent power management, reducing energy consumption by 20-30% and improving material utilization to 85%, with a 2025 target of 75% customer products using recycled plastics. Arcadyan advances through energy efficiency, circularity, and collaboration strategies, building green competitiveness from manufacturing to market as a low-carbon innovation leader in electronics manufacturing.
Arcadyan stood out from fierce competition among nearly a thousand listed companies to be selected again for the 2025 Carbon Competitiveness Top 100, demonstrating its outstanding performance in sustainability transformation, carbon reduction initiatives, and governance management. This recognition not only affirms Arcadyan's carbon reduction efforts but also highlights the company's unwavering commitment to environmental responsibility and concrete action. Looking ahead, Arcadyan will continue to integrate resources, drive innovative carbon reduction measures, and dedicate itself to developing environmentally friendly products to jointly build a sustainable future.
